revised_title: Henry Fairfield Osborn: A Pioneering Vertebrate Palaeontologist
tldr: Henry Fairfield Osborn was a prominent biologist and vertebrate palaeontologist who made significant contributions to the study of extinct vertebrates. He organized the collection, arrangement, and study of fossil vertebrates at the American Museum of Natural History and conducted numerous expeditions to collect fossils from various regions. Osborn's research focused on the correlation of Tertiary mammal horizons, the evolution of mammals, and the study of dinosaurs, rhinoceroses, horses, titanotheres, and elephants. He also made important contributions to the understanding of human evolution and prehistory.
